required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 22, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in Germany (LIFE-C)
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in Germany (LIFE-C)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration
Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

brief_summary.textblock:
The interferon-free combination regimen of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir with or without Dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) ± ribavirin (RBV) for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC) has been shown to be safe and effective in randomized controlled clinical trials with strict inclusion and exclusion criteria under well controlled conditions.
This observational study is the first effectiveness research examining the ABBVIE REGIMEN ± RBV, used according to local label, under real world conditions in Germany in a clinical practice patient population.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Sustained Virologic Response (SVR12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid less than the lower limit of quantification 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Support Program (PSP) Utilization and Satisfaction Assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire to evaluate the utilization of the patient-support-program in percent and effect of participation on treatment-effectiveness; patient satisfaction with PSP
Case report form collection will evaluate the usage pattern of the treatment regimen

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Participant Activation with the Patient Activation Measure (PAM-13) Questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire measures patient knowledge, skill and confidence for self-management

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Relapse or Reinfection
secondary_outcome.description: Relapse is defined as (detectable viral load at SVR12) or reinfection (detectable viral load after achieving SVR12 until post treatment week 48)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy- Fatigue (FACIT-F) Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From week 0 to post treatment week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Participants Workability Measured with the Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI):Hepatitis C Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire measures work time missed, work and non-work activity impairment due to a specified healthy problem during the past seven days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Participants Burden of Suffering Measured with The Pictorial Representation of Illness and Self-Measure (PRISM) tool

arm_group.description: GT1 participants receiving Dasabuvir+ Ombitasvir+Paritraprevir+Ritonavir + Ribavirin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment-naïve or -experienced patients with confirmed CHC, genotype 1 or 4, receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free ABBVIE REGIMEN ± RBV according to standard of care and in line with local label.
- If RBV is co-administered with the ABBVIE REGIMEN, it has been prescribed in line with the current local label (with special attention to contraception requirements and contraindication during pregnancy)
- Patients must voluntarily sign and date a patient authorization to use and/or disclose his/her pseudonymized health data prior to inclusion into the study
- Patient must not be participating or intending to participate in a concurrent interventional therapeutic trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adolescents; people not treated according to label
